oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tennessee's 175 years of Statehood

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Details the 175th anniversary of Tennessee statehood celebration to be held on Capitol Hill.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides; Announcements; Handbills; Fliers (printed matter); Fireworks; Firecrackers
Broadsides
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Faced with the difficulties inherent in the unprecedented admission of a territory under the Northwest Ordinance of 1789 as well as the election-year struggle between the Federalists and the Jeffersonian Republicans, Tennessee sent a printed copy of its constitution and a report on census returns to Congress for approval on April 8, 1796. Tennessee became the sixteenth state admitted to the Union on June 1, 1796.
